answers.answer: Yes, it could be an a urinary infection.  Urinary infections don't always hurt when your urinate.Other reasons can be from a sensitive bladder and weak pelvic muscles and also having diabetes.Make an appointment to see your doctor to get your urine checked and tell him your symptoms so that he can do other checks.
No this is not an infection i would know

question: Ive had 3 kids so i know what its like to be huge, pregnant an have a full bladder but i finally have made it a full year without getting pregnant again. I have the paragard iud i don't know if that makes a difference but honestly im peeing constantly an this has been going on for weeks. I will literally pee before i go to the store an will barely make it out without peeing my pants. One time i did have an accident. I try to make sure im drinking enough but im definitely not over drinking. Im in constant fear that im gonna have an accident in public. When i do dishes an the water is running i immediately have to stop an dash to the bathroom!! Im so tired of running to the bathroom. An it cant be an infection nothing hurts nothing burns idk i cant do this anymore! Help
title: constant potty breaks
